subject: Economics
title: Clean Water: The Infrastructure of Life
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Clean Water: The Infrastructure of Life.

hook.text: 2 billion people lack safe drinking water. Diarrheal diseases kill 500,000 children under 5 each year.

buildup.text: Contaminated water causes cholera, typhoid, and chronic diarrhea.

discovery.text: The WHO estimates every $1 invested in water sanitation returns $4 in economic productivity.

twist.text: In 19th-century London, clean water investments increased life expectancy more than all medical advances combined.

climax.text: Clean water is infrastructure, not charity. It enables health, education, gender equality, and economic productivity.

punchline.text: The most transformative technology in human history isn't the computer.

quiz.question: What is the estimated economic return on investment in water sanitation?
options: Every $1 invested returns $4 in economic productivity
